title: Authors and Citation
text: da Silva N, Cook D, Lee E (2025). PPtreeExt: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/natydasilva/PPtreeExt.
code: @Manual{,   title = {PPtreeExt: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions},   author = {Natalia {da Silva} and Dianne Cook and Eun-Kyung Lee},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/natydasilva/PPtreeExt}, }

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions
text: PPtreeExt R package extensons Projection Pursuit Tree (PPtree) algorithm improve performance multi-class settings nonlinear separations. PPtree classifier finds separations classes based linear combinations variables optimizing projection pursuit index. One limitations rigid structure: depth PPtree object GG-1, GG number classes, class assigned single terminal node. proposed modifications enhance predictive performance multi-class contexts, particularly situations involving outliers asymmetries. objective increase classifier’s flexibility handle complex scenarios, retaining interpretability. package includes interactive web application explore behavior original modified PPtree classifiers variety scenarios. interactive tool played key role identifying limitations original algorithm informing design proposed modifications.

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions
text: Install version CRAN (available yet!): Install development version GitHub:
code: install.packages("PPTreeExt") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("natydasilva/PPtreeExt")

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions
code: set.seed(234) data(penguins) penguins <- na.omit(penguins[, -c(2,7, 8)]) require(rsample) penguins_spl <- rsample::initial_split(penguins, strata=species) penguins_train <- training(penguins_spl) penguins_test <- testing(penguins_spl) penguins_ppt <- PPtreeExtclass(species~bill_len + bill_dep + flipper_len + body_mass, data = penguins_train, PPmethod = "LDA", tot=nrow (penguins_train), tol =  0.2 , srule = TRUE) =============================================================  Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extension result  =============================================================  1) root    2)* proj1*X < cut1  ->  "Gentoo"    3)  proj1*X >= cut1       4)* proj2*X < cut2  ->  "Adelie"       5)* proj2*X >= cut2  ->  "Chinstrap"  Error rates  ------------------------------------------------------------- [1] 1  pred<- predict(object = penguins_ppt, newdata = penguins_test[,-1], true.class = penguins_test$species)     pred$predict.error [1] 2  pred$predict.class   [1] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"     [7] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    [13] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    [19] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    [25] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    [31] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    [37] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    [43] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    [49] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    [55] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    [61] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    [67] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" [73] "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Adelie"    "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" [79] "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Adelie"    [85] "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" plot(penguins_ppt)

title: PP optimization using LDA index — LDAopt_Ext
code: LDAopt_Ext(origclass, origdata, q = 1, weight = TRUE, ...)

title: PP optimization using LDA index — LDAopt_Ext
text: origclass Factor numeric vector containing class labels observation. origdata Numeric matrix data frame containing predictor variables without class information. row represents observation column represents variable. q Integer specifying dimension projection space. Default 1 1-dimensional projection. weight Logical indicating whether use weighted LDA index calculation. Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed internal optimization methods.

title: PP optimization using LDA index — LDAopt_Ext
text: object class "PPoptim", list containing: indexbest Numeric value representing maximum LDA index achieved   optimal projection. Higher values indicate better class separation. projbest Numeric matrix optimal projection coefficients dimensions   ncol(origdata) q. column represents optimal projection   direction maximizes LDA index class separation. origclass original class information vector passed input, preserved   reference. origdata original data matrix without class information, preserved   reference.

title: PP optimization using LDA index — LDAopt_Ext
text: Finds q-dimensional optimal projection using Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) projection pursuit index. implementation follows method described PPtree. LDA projection pursuit index measures class separation maximizing ratio -class variance within-class variance projected space. function: Calls LDAopt find optimal q-dimensional projection directions Evaluates LDA index optimal projection using LDAindex2 Returns projection matrix associated index value weight = TRUE, index calculation accounts class proportions, giving appropriate weight class optimization.

title: PP optimization using LDA index — LDAopt_Ext
text: Lee, EK., Cook, D., Klinke, S., Lumley, T. (2005) Projection Pursuit Exploratory Supervised Classification, Journal Computational Graphical Statistics, 14(4):831-846.

code: PDAopt_Ext(origclass, origdata, q = 1, weight = TRUE, lambda = 0.1, ...)

title: PP optimization using PDA index — PDAopt_Ext
text: origclass Factor numeric vector containing class labels observation. origdata Numeric matrix data frame containing predictor variables without class information. row represents observation column represents variable. q Integer specifying dimension projection space. Default 1 1-dimensional projection. weight Logical indicating whether use weighted PDA index calculation. Default TRUE. lambda Numeric penalty parameter PDA index. Controls amount regularization applied. Default 0.1. Higher values increase regularization, useful high-dimensional collinear data. ... Additional arguments passed internal optimization methods.

title: PP optimization using PDA index — PDAopt_Ext
text: object class "PPoptim", list containing: indexbest Numeric value representing maximum PDA index achieved   optimal projection. Higher values indicate better class separation appropriate   regularization. projbest Numeric matrix optimal projection coefficients dimensions   ncol(origdata) q. column represents optimal projection   direction maximizes PDA index class separation. origclass original class information vector passed input, preserved   reference. origdata original data matrix without class information, preserved   reference.

title: PP optimization using PDA index — PDAopt_Ext
text: Finds q-dimensional optimal projection using Penalized Discriminant Analysis (PDA) projection pursuit index. implementation follows method described PPtree particularly useful high-dimensional data (large p, small n). Penalized Discriminant Analysis (PDA) projection pursuit index extends LDA incorporating penalty term, making particularly suitable : High-dimensional data number variables exceeds number observations (p > n) Data multicollinearity among predictor variables Cases standard LDA fails due singular covariance matrices function performs following steps: Calls PDAopt find optimal q-dimensional projection directions regularization Evaluates PDA index optimal projection using PDAindex2 Returns projection matrix associated index value lambda parameter controls trade-maximizing class separation regularization. weight = TRUE, index calculation accounts class proportions optimization.

title: PP optimization using PDA index — PDAopt_Ext
text: Lee, EK, Cook, D. (2010) Projection Pursuit Index Large p Small n Data, Statistics Computing, 20:381-392.

what: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
text: Constructs projection pursuit classification tree using various projection pursuit indices. Optionally performs random variable selection split can used include random forests methodology. size.p = 1, reduces  PPtree algorithm.

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
code: PPtreeExt_split(   formula,   data,   PPmethod = "LDA",   size.p = 1,   lambda = 0.1,   entro = FALSE,   entroindiv = FALSE,   ... )

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
text: formula formula form class ~ x1 + x2 + ... class factor variable containing class labels x1, x2, ... predictor variables. data Data frame containing class variable predictor variables. PPmethod Character string specifying projection pursuit index use. Either "LDA" (Linear Discriminant Analysis, default) "PDA" (Penalized Discriminant Analysis). size.p Numeric value 0 1 specifying proportion variables randomly sample split. Default 1, uses variables split (standard PPtree). Values less 1 introduce randomness similar random forests, can improve robustness reduce overfitting. lambda Numeric penalty parameter PDA index, ranging 0 1. lambda = 0, penalty applied PDA equals LDA. lambda = 1, variables treated uncorrelated. Default 0.1. used PPmethod = "PDA". entro Logical indicating whether use entropy-based stopping rules tree construction. Default FALSE. entroindiv Logical indicating whether compute entropy individual observation 1D projection. Default FALSE. ... Additional arguments passed internal tree construction methods.

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
text: object class "PPtreeclass", list containing: Tree.Struct matrix defining tree structure projection pursuit   classification tree. row represents node columns: node ID, left child   node ID, right child node ID (final class terminal), coefficient ID,   index value. projbest.node matrix row contains optimal 1-dimensional   projection coefficients split node. number columns equals   number predictor variables. splitCutoff.node data frame containing cutoff values splitting   rules split node. Contains 8 rule columns defining classification   boundaries. origclass Factor vector original class labels input data. origdata Matrix original predictor variables (without class variable).

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
text: function extends standard PPtree algorithm incorporating random variable selection split, define split based subsetting groups. algorithm: node, randomly samples size.p * 100% predictor variables Finds optimal projection using selected variables specified index (LDA PDA) Determines cutpoint based entropy splitting entropy parameters set Recursively splits data stopping criteria met entro parameter enables entropy-based stopping rules halt splitting nodes become sufficiently pure small. entroindiv parameter computes entropy individual observation level projected space, can provide refined splitting decisions. size.p = 1, variables used split function behaves standard PPtree. Values size.p < 1 introduce randomness can improve model robustness, especially high-dimensional data building ensemble models.

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
text: Lee, YD, Cook, D., Park JW, Lee, EK (2013) PPtree: Projection pursuit classification tree, Electronic Journal Statistics, 7:1369-1386.

title: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree with Random Variable Selection — PPtreeExt_split
code: data(penguins) penguins <- na.omit(penguins[, -c(2,7, 8)]) require(rsample) #> Loading required package: rsample penguins_spl <- rsample::initial_split(penguins, strata=species) penguins_train <- training(penguins_spl) penguins_test <- testing(penguins_spl) penguins_ppt2 <- PPtreeExt_split(species~bill_len + bill_dep + flipper_len + body_mass, data = penguins_train, PPmethod = "LDA", tot=nrow (penguins_train), tol =  0.5 , entro=TRUE)

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
code: PPtreeExtclass(formula, data, PPmethod = "LDA", weight = TRUE,                    lambda = 0.1,srule, tot = nrow(data), tol = 0.5,...)

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: formula object class "formula" form class ~ x1 + x2 + ... class factor variable containing class labels x1, x2, ... predictor variables. Interaction terms (using *) supported. data Data frame containing class variable predictor variables specified formula. PPmethod Character string specifying projection pursuit index use. Either "LDA" (Linear Discriminant Analysis, default) "PDA" (Penalized Discriminant Analysis). weight Logical indicating whether use weighted index calculation LDA PDA. TRUE (default), class proportions accounted optimization. lambda Numeric penalty parameter PDA index, ranging 0 1. Default 0.1. used PPmethod = "PDA". srule Logical flag stopping rule. TRUE (default), uses entropy-based size-based stopping criteria. FALSE, stops nodes pure (single class) empty. tot Integer specifying total number observations original dataset. Default nrow(data). Used conjunction stopping rules determine minimum node sizes. tol Numeric tolerance value entropy-based stopping rule. Nodes entropy threshold split . Default 0.5. Lower values create deeper trees. ... Additional arguments passed internal tree construction methods.

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: object class c("PPtreeExtclass", "PPtreeclass"), list containing: Tree.Struct matrix defining tree structure. row represents node   5 columns: node ID, left child node ID, right/final node ID (class label   terminal node), coefficient ID (projection index), optimization index value. projbest.node matrix row contains optimal 1-dimensional   projection coefficients split node. row length equal   ncol(origdata), defining projection direction used node. splitCutoff.node numeric vector matrix containing cutoff values   (thresholds) used split node classification decisions. origclass Factor vector original class labels input data. origdata Matrix original predictor variables (without class variable). terms terms object model frame, preserving formula structure.

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: Constructs projection pursuit classification tree using various projection pursuit indices (LDA PDA) split. extended version includes customizable stopping rules based entropy node size criteria. function builds binary classification tree split determined finding optimal projection data onto one-dimensional space using either LDA PDA indices. algorithm works follows: tol parameter controls tree complexity: smaller values allow splits (deeper trees potentially better training accuracy higher risk overfitting), larger values create simpler trees (better generalization potentially underfitting).

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: node, find optimal 1D projection best separates classes Project data onto direction find optimal cutpoint Split observations based cutpoint left right child nodes Recursively repeat stopping criteria met

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: srule = TRUE, node stops splitting following conditions hold: node pure (contains one class) node contains fewer 5% total observations (n/tot <= 0.05) node entropy tolerance threshold (entropy < tol) srule = FALSE, splitting stops pure empty nodes, potentially creating deeper, complex trees.

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: LDA: Suitable classification problems moderate dimensionality PDA: Recommended high-dimensional data (p > n) data multicollinearity

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: function support interaction terms formula. Use additive terms (e.g., y ~ x1 + x2) multiplicative terms (e.g., y ~ x1 * x2).

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
text: Lee, YD, Cook, D., Park JW, Lee, EK (2013) PPtree: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree, Electronic Journal Statistics, 7:1369-1386.

title: Projection pursuit classification tree — PPtreeExtclass
code: set.seed(234) data(penguins) penguins <- na.omit(penguins[, -c(2,7, 8)]) require(rsample) penguins_spl <- rsample::initial_split(penguins, strata=species) penguins_train <- training(penguins_spl) penguins_test <- testing(penguins_spl) penguins_ppt <- PPtreeExtclass(species~bill_len + bill_dep + flipper_len + body_mass, data = penguins_train, PPmethod = "LDA", tot=nrow (penguins_train), tol =  0.2 , srule = TRUE)

what: Projection pursuit classification tree extensions — TreeExt.construct
title: Projection pursuit classification tree extensions — TreeExt.construct
text: Construct projection pursuit classification tree extensions

title: Projection pursuit classification tree extensions — TreeExt.construct
code: TreeExt.construct(origclass, origdata, Tree.Struct, id, rep, rep1, rep2, projbest.node, splitCutoff.node, PPmethod,  lambda = NULL, q = 1, weight = TRUE, srule=TRUE, tot=NULL, tol = .5,...)

title: Projection pursuit classification tree extensions — TreeExt.construct
text: origclass factor numeric vector containing class labels observation. origdata data frame original data without class variable Tree.Struct tree structure projection pursuit classification tree id tree node id rep internal counter nodes rep1 internal counter nodes rep2 internal counter nodes projbest.node bests projection node splitCutoff.node cutof node PPmethod method projection pursuit; "LDA", "PDA" lambda lambda PDA index q numeric value dimension projected data, 1 1D projection used weight weight flag LDA, PDA srule stopping rule flag; TRUE use stopping rule, FALSE stop pure empty nodes tot total number observations tol tolerance value entropy stopping rule splitting node ... additional arguments pass trough

title: Projection pursuit classification tree extensions — TreeExt.construct
text: list containing complete tree structure node information: Tree.Struct matrix row represents node projection pursuit classification tree. matrix 5 columns: Column 1: Node ID Column 2: ID left child node (0 terminal node) Column 3: ID right child node, predicted class label terminal node Column 4: Projection index (projection vector used node) Column 5: Optimization criterion value projection node  projbest.node matrix row contains optimal projection coefficients (Alpha vector) split node. splitCutoff.node matrix/vector containing optimal cutpoint values used split node. rep Integer counter tracking current node processed (internal use). rep1 Integer counter assigning child node IDs (internal use). rep2 Integer counter tracking projection indices (internal use).

title: Projection pursuit classification tree extensions — TreeExt.construct
text: Find tree structure using various projection pursuit indices classification split. function recursively constructs binary classification tree using projection pursuit. node, finds optimal projection direction best separates classes, determines cutpoint, creates child nodes stopping criteria met (pure nodes, small node size, low entropy).

what: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
title: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
text: Finds optimal 1D projection multivariate data best separates classes using Linear Discriminant Analysis (LDA) Penalized Discriminant Analysis (PDA), determines cutpoint classification based entropy splitting.

title: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
code: findproj_Ext(   origclass,   origdata,   PPmethod = "LDA",   q = 1,   weight = TRUE,   lambda = 0.1 )

title: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
text: origclass Factor numeric vector containing class labels observation. origdata Numeric matrix data frame containing predictor variables. row represents observation column represents variable. PPmethod Character string specifying projection pursuit method. Either "LDA" (Linear Discriminant Analysis, default) "PDA" (Penalized Discriminant Analysis). q Integer specifying dimension projected data. Default 1 1D projection. weight Logical indicating whether use weighted LDA index calculation. Default TRUE. lambda Numeric penalty parameter PDA method. Default 0.1. used PPmethod = "PDA".

title: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
text: list following components: Index Numeric value representing optimization criterion achieved   best projection. Higher values indicate better class separation. Alpha Numeric vector length ncol(origdata) containing optimal   projection direction coefficients. vector defines linear combination   original variables maximizes class separation. C Numeric scalar representing optimal cutpoint (threshold)   projected data. value determined using entropy-based splitting   divides observations two groups classification. IOindexL Logical vector length nrow(origdata) indicating   observations projected values less equal cutpoint C   (projdata <= C). observations assigned left node/class. IOindexR Logical vector length nrow(origdata) indicating   observations projected values greater cutpoint C (projdata > C).   observations assigned right node/class.

title: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
text: function performs projection pursuit find one-dimensional projection optimally separates classes multivariate data. process involves: Finding optimal projection direction using either LDA PDA Projecting observations onto direction Determining optimal cutpoint using entropy-based splitting Creating binary classification indicators based cutpoint cutpoint calculated minimize weighted entropy resulting split. edge cases cutpoint equals maximum projected value, function uses second-largest value ensure valid split.

title: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
text: vectors IOindexL IOindexR complementary   (mutually exclusive exhaustive), meaning every observation assigned   exactly one group.

title: Find Optimal Projection for Class Separation — findproj_Ext
text: Lee, YD, Cook, D., Park JW, Lee, EK (2013) PPtree: Projection Pursuit Classification Tree, Electronic Journal Statistics, 7:1369-1386.

what: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
title: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
text: Visualizes Projection Pursuit (PP) classification tree  using grid graphics. function creates hierarchical tree diagram showing structure splits terminal nodes class assignments. Supports automatic scaling large trees.

title: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
code: # S3 method for class 'PPtreeExtclass' plot(   x,   font.size = 17,   width.size = 1,   main = "Projection Pursuit Classification Tree",   sub = NULL,   auto.scale = TRUE,   min.width = NULL,   min.height = NULL,   ... )

title: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
text: x object class PPtreeclass PPtreeExtclass containing tree structure, projection vectors, split points. font.size Numeric. Font size text labels plot. Default 17. automatically reduced large trees auto.scale = TRUE. width.size Numeric. Width scaling factor graphical elements (nodes, edges). Default 1. automatically adjusted large trees auto.scale = TRUE. main Character string. Main title plot. Default "Projection Pursuit Classification Tree". sub Character string NULL. Subtitle plot. Default NULL (subtitle). auto.scale Logical. TRUE (default), automatically adjusts plot dimensions font size based tree size. Recommended trees 20 terminal nodes depth greater 15. min.width Numeric NULL. Minimum width (number terminal nodes) plot auto.scale = FALSE. NULL, uses number classes data. Default NULL. min.height Numeric NULL. Minimum height (tree depth) plot auto.scale = FALSE. NULL, uses calculated tree depth. Default NULL. ... Additional arguments (currently used).

title: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
text: Invisibly returns list : width Numeric. width used plotting (number terminal nodes) height Numeric. height used plotting (tree depth) font.size Numeric. final font size used (auto-scaling)

title: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
text: plot displays: Internal nodes: Shown ellipses projection used     splitting (e.g., "proj1 * X") Terminal nodes: Shown gray rectangles assigned     class label Edges: Labeled split rules ("< cutN" left child,     ">= cutN" right child) Node IDs: Small boxes top node Auto-scaling behavior: auto.scale = TRUE tree 20 terminal nodes depth greater 15: Font size reduced: max(10, 17 - floor((n_terminal - 20) / 5)) Width size reduced: max(0.7, 1 - (n_terminal - 20) * 0.01) Width set : max(n_terminal, n_classes) Height set : tree depth Manual scaling: auto.scale = FALSE, can control dimensions min.width min.height.

title: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
text: function requires grid package. create new graphics page using grid.newpage(). large trees (>50 terminal nodes), consider: Exporting large PNG PDF file Manually reducing font.size Pruning tree plotting

title: Plot Projection Pursuit Classification Tree — plot.PPtreeExtclass
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(grid) # Example with penguins dataset data(penguins) penguins <- na.omit(penguins[, -c(2,7)]) penguins_ppt <- PPtreeExtclass(species~bill_len + bill_dep +flipper_len +  body_mass,  data = penguins, PPmethod = "PDA", srule = FALSE )  plot(penguins_ppt,      main = "Penguins Classification with PPtreeExt",       font.size = 8,         width.size = 0.7) } # }

what: Predict Method for Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions — predict.PPtreeExtclass
title: Predict Method for Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions — predict.PPtreeExtclass
text: Predicts class labels new observations using fitted projection pursuit classification tree optionally calculates prediction error true class labels provided.

title: Predict Method for Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions — predict.PPtreeExtclass
code: # S3 method for class 'PPtreeExtclass' predict(object, newdata, true.class = NULL, ...)

title: Predict Method for Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions — predict.PPtreeExtclass
text: object object class "PPtreeExtclass" PPtreeExtclass PPtreeExt_split. newdata data frame matrix containing predictor variables predictions made. Must contain variables (order) used training data, without class variable. true.class Optional vector true class labels test data. provided, prediction error calculated. Can either numeric factor. Default NULL. ... Additional arguments (currently used).

title: Predict Method for Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions — predict.PPtreeExtclass
text: list two components: predict.class character vector predicted class labels   observation newdata. predict.error Integer count prediction errors (misclassifications).   computed true.class provided; otherwise returns NA.

title: Predict Method for Projection Pursuit Classification Tree Extensions — predict.PPtreeExtclass
code: data(penguins) penguins <- na.omit(penguins[, -c(2,7, 8)]) require(rsample) penguins_spl <- rsample::initial_split(penguins, strata=species) penguins_train <- training(penguins_spl) penguins_test <- testing(penguins_spl) penguins_ppt <- PPtreeExtclass(species~bill_len + bill_dep + flipper_len + body_mass, data = penguins_train, PPmethod = "LDA", tot =nrow (penguins_train), tol=0.5) predict(object = penguins_ppt, newdata = penguins_test[,-1], true.class = penguins_test$species) #> $predict.error #> [1] 3 #>  #> $predict.class #>  [1] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    #>  [7] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    #> [13] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    #> [19] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    #> [25] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    #> [31] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Adelie"    #> [37] "Adelie"    "Adelie"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    #> [43] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    #> [49] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    #> [55] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    #> [61] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    #> [67] "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Gentoo"    "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" #> [73] "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Adelie"    "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" #> [79] "Adelie"    "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" "Adelie"    "Chinstrap" #> [85] "Chinstrap" "Chinstrap" #>

what: Print Method for PPtreeExtclass Objects — print.PPtreeExtclass
title: Print Method for PPtreeExtclass Objects — print.PPtreeExtclass
text: Prints summary fitted projection pursuit classification tree, including tree structure, optionally projection coefficients cutoff values, training error rate.

title: Print Method for PPtreeExtclass Objects — print.PPtreeExtclass
code: # S3 method for class 'PPtreeExtclass' print(x, coef.print = FALSE, cutoff.print = FALSE, verbose = TRUE, ...)

title: Print Method for PPtreeExtclass Objects — print.PPtreeExtclass
text: x object class "PPtreeExtclass" PPtreeExtclass PPtreeExt_split. coef.print Logical indicating whether print projection coefficients split node. Default FALSE. cutoff.print Logical indicating whether print cutoff values split node. Default FALSE. verbose Logical indicating whether print tree structure error rate. FALSE, function returns tree structure invisibly without printing. Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments (currently used).

title: Print Method for PPtreeExtclass Objects — print.PPtreeExtclass
text: function traverses tree structure stored x$Tree.Struct creates hierarchical text representation. coef.print = TRUE, projection coefficients (linear combinations features) used split displayed. cutoff.print = TRUE, threshold values used determine left/right splits shown. training error rate computed applying fitted tree original training data.
